summary: This document is a notice of service of a Rule 45 subpoena issued by the plaintiff's attorneys to Shopper's Travel, Inc. in the civil case against Ghislaine Maxwell. The subpoena commands the travel agency to produce extensive travel records from 1999 onward related to Jeffrey Epstein, Ghislaine Maxwell, and any minors they may have facilitated travel for.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the civil case (15-cv-07433-RWS). The subpoena seeks all travel documentation related to her from 1999 onward.

persons.name: Sigrid McCawley
persons.context: Attorney from Boies Schiller & Flexner LLP who signed and issued the notice of service for the subpoena.

persons.name: Ellen Brockman
persons.context: Attorney from Boies Schiller & Flexner LLP listed on the notice of service.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Defined broadly in the subpoena to include himself and any entities he owned or controlled. The subpoena seeks all travel documentation related to him from 1999 onward, especially for travel involving minors.

connections.description: The subpoena seeks travel records for both individuals, indicating they are central, connected subjects of the civil discovery. The definitions treat them similarly for the purpose of gathering records from their agents and entities.
McCawley is an attorney for the plaintiff who is pursuing the civil action against defendant Ghislaine Maxwell.
Both are attorneys from the same law firm (Boies Schiller & Flexner LLP) representing the plaintiff in the case against Maxwell.

events.title: Subpoena Issued
events.description: The Clerk of Court issued the subpoena to Shopper's Travel, Inc.

events.title: Notice of Service Filed
events.description: Plaintiff's attorneys filed the notice that the subpoena had been served upon Shopper's Travel, Inc.

events.title: Document Production Deadline
events.description: The subpoena commands Shopper's Travel, Inc. to produce the requested documents at the law firm's office by this date.

locations: Southern District of New York (Court jurisdiction)
New York, NY 10016 (Address for Shopper's Travel, Inc.)
Ft. Lauderdale, FL 33301 (Address for Boies Schiller & Flexner LLP)
New York, New York 10022 (Address for Boies Schiller & Flexner LLP)
keyFacts: The plaintiff in a civil case against Ghislaine Maxwell subpoenaed a travel agency (Shopper's Travel, Inc.) for all travel records from 1999 onward related to Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.

The subpoena specifically seeks records of travel facilitated by Epstein or Maxwell for any individual who was under the age of 18 at the time of travel, including documents that identify a passenger's age.
The definitions in the subpoena expansively define 'Jeffrey Epstein' and 'Ghislaine Maxwell' to include any entities they owned or controlled, and any of their employees, agents, or representatives.
The relevant time period for the document request is from 1999 to the present (as of April 2016), covering a 17-year span.
